chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Garett H. Seidl was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

miscConds.notes: Fine $3,035. $1,600 bond to be applied. Balance to be paid during probation
Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.

Absolute sobriety
No entrance into any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.

Def must give DNA sample 2-17-17
Def must attend the VIP on 5-4-17 at 6pm
Undergo assessments, treatments, and counseling as recommended by agent.
Attend a minimum of 3 support group meetings each week for the duration of your community supervision.
Obtain a support group sponsor within one month of your community supervision.
Work through 12-steps to recovery during your term of supervision.
If you unemployed after month of supervision, def shall complete a minimum of 25 hours of community service per week until full-time employment is gained.
Take part in random monthly drug testing as facilitated by agent. Def must pay for drug tests.
Pay supervision fees

timeConds.notes: With good time and huber release.

Defendant Garett H. Seidl in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Defendant Garett H. Seidl in custody.  Allen R Brey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Scholz spks on PSI corrections
DA spks on sentencing
Atty Scholz spks on sentencing
Court vacates conviction on ct 4
Court imposes:
Imposed and stayed: 2 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision. Eligible for SAP. Not eligible for CIP.
3 years probation:
6 months jail with good time and huber. 65 days credit.
Fine $3,035-$1,600 bond to be applied. Balance to be paid during probation
36 mo rev
AODA
Ignition Interlock
Def must give DNA sample today
Def must attend the VIP on 5-4-17 at 6pm
Absolute sobriety
Undergo assessments, treatments, and counseling as recommended by agent
No entrance into any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Must attend no less than 3 support groups each week
Obtain support group sponsor within one month of term or supervision
If unemployed after 1 month of supervision, must complete 25 hours of community service per week until full-time employment is gained.
Must participate in a 12 step program during the entire term of probation
Random drug tests as determined by agent- Def must pay for drug tests
Pay supervision fees  
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Appeal rights
